Description: Fragment of wall of North Ionian pottery dinos or krater. Fabric red-brown. Inside reserved. Broad band, below which part of a wild goat moving right with head turned back and part of another goat to right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College Dublin, Department of Classics, Classical Museum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Vickers notes that the broad band above the frieze is unusual, though the parallel he cites is not close.
Bibliographic references: CVA UCD & UCC / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Ireland, Fascicule 1: University College Dublin, University College Cork (p. 11, no. 5, pl. 10, no. 5)
Vickers 1971 / Some Unpublished Sherds from Naukratis in Dublin (p. 114, no. 6, pl. 13.F)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.284)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: AN1896-1908-G.119.17 (old Ashmolean Museum accession number)
